            OF THE LAKE CHAD BASIN PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Project will ensure that the
            integrity of the Lake Chad system (which involves six
            surrounding countries), is protected by integrated
            management of the basin's resources, by building
            capacity among riparians and stakeholders, completing a
            trans-boundary diagnostic analysis, and preparing a
            strategic action program. However, the degradation of the
            natural resource base, with the consequent impacts on local
            populations, requires an environmental, and social
            assessment. To this end, this environmental assessment,
            based on the appraisals of the Cameroon, and Nigeria Dams
            (v. 1 and 2), and on integrated environmental and social
            assessments (v.3), proposes mitigation measures as follows.
            The rehabilitation, and construction of a wildlife pond in
            Waza, will adversely impact natural habitats, forcing
            wildlife concentrations and an increased localized grazing
            to build pressure around the water point; thus, water points
            should be spread over a greater area, and grazing practices
            limited. Additionally, new water points should avoid upland
            forest areas, to prevent vegetation degradation. Floodplain
            connecting channels will be enlarged and blockages cleared,
            but river flows may be either reduced or increased, thereby
            disturbing ecosystems; engineering/environmental consultants
            should monitor river flows, taking remedial action as
            needed. The identification of critical wetlands for
            conservation will increase pressure on floodplain resources;
            an environmental consultant should monitor soil erosion, and
            review the impacts of conservation on threatened cultivars.
            A process framework for mitigation of social impacts (v. 5)
            provides measures to assist affected populations, following
            an eligibility criteria, and based on public consultations.
